summary: Louis H. Hindle was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents available are payroll certifications from February 1977, November 1977, and December 1977, which list Hindle's name and salary as part of the committee staff. The specific role or duties of Hindle within the HSCA are not detailed in these documents, but his presence on the payroll indicates he was a staff member during the HSCA's investigation into the JFK assassination.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Louis H. Hindle's significance lies in his employment with the HSCA during its investigation into the JFK assassination. While the exact nature of his work is not specified in these payroll documents, his presence as a paid staff member suggests he contributed to the committee's efforts.
